entry.title: SPM12 TUTORIALS（一）
entry.content:
Step 1：

download MATLAB，SPM

Matlab acquisition method：

Method 1：购买许可证

Method 2：使用 Campus-Wide License

https://ww2.mathworks.cn/academia/tah-support-program/eligibility.html

输入你的学校名称和校园邮箱（比如 学号@westlake.edu.cn）

Method 3：申请 CUMCM 许可证

Method 4：申请其他比赛许可证

SPM acquisition method：（spm12）

description

官网：

https://www.fil.ion.ucl.ac.uk/spm

下载：

https://www.fil.ion.ucl.ac.uk/spm/software/download

安装说明：

https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/SPM#Installation

windows安装说明：

https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/SPM/Installation_on_64bit_Windows

Installation
Download spm12.zip.
Unzip spm12.zip in a folder of your choice

such as C:\Users\login\Documents\MATLAB\spm12

Start MATLAB and add SPM into your path

either using File > Set Path > Add Folder… or typing

addpath C:\Users\login\Documents\MATLAB\spm12
in MATLAB’s workspace.

Launch SPM by typing

spm

example

https://www.fil.ion.ucl.ac.uk/spm/data

entry.title: My New Post
小题狂练（1）
entry.content:
1. $$
    \lim_{x\rightarrow0}{\frac{\sin(x\sin{\frac{1}{x}})}{x\sin{\frac{1}{x}}}}
    $$
判断极限是否存在。若存在，求出此极限；若不存在，给出证明。
  1. $$
    \lim_{x\rightarrow0}{\frac{\sin(x^2\sin{\frac{1}{x}})}{x}}
    $$
判断极限是否存在。若存在，求出此极限；若不存在，给出证明。

entry.title: 小题狂练（2）
entry.content:
求下述算式的定积分。

$$
\int_{0}^{1}\frac{x-1}{\ln{x}}dx
$$

答案
\( \begin{align*} & \int_{0}^{1}\frac{x-1}{\ln{x}}dx \\ &= \int_{0}^{1}\frac{x^1-1^0}{\ln{x}}dx \\ &= \ln{\frac{1+1}{0+1}} \\ &= \ln{2} \end{align*} \)




$$
\int_{0}^{1}\frac{x^a-x^b}{\ln{x}}dx
$$

详解
方法1：转化成二重积分

\( \begin{align*} & \int_{0}^{1}\frac{x^a-x^b}{\ln{x}}dx \\ &= \int_{0}^{1}(\frac{x^b}{\ln{x}}-\frac{x^a}{\ln{x}})dx \\ &= \int_{0}^{1}(\int_{a}^{b}{x^y}dy)dx \\ &= \int_{a}^{b}dy\int_{0}^{1}{x^y}dx \\ &= \int_{a}^{b}\frac{x^y+1}{y+1}dy \\ &= \int_{a}^{b}\frac{1}{y+1}dy \\ &= (\ln{y+1})|^b_a \\ &= \ln{\frac{b+1}{a+1}} \end{align*} \)

方法2：先求导再积分（费曼积分法）

令 \( \begin{align*} & f(a,b)=\int_{0}^{1}(\frac{x^b}{\ln{x}}-\frac{x^a}{\ln{x}})dx \\ \end{align*} \)

\( \begin{align*} & f'(a,b) = \int_{0}^{1}(x^b-x^a)dx = \frac{1}{b+1}-\frac{1}{a+1} \end{align*} \)

\( \begin{align*} & \int_{}{}f'(a,b)d(a,b) = \ln{\frac{b+1}{a+1}}+C \end{align*} \)

\( \begin{align*} & \because f'(0,0) = 0 \end{align*} \)

\( \begin{align*} & \therefore C = 0 \end{align*} \)

即 \( \begin{align*} & \int_{0}^{1}\frac{x^a-x^b}{\ln{x}}dx = \ln{\frac{b+1}{a+1}} \end{align*} \)
